intro: Tripogandra ionantha, commonly known as the Hawaiian starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its star-shaped, white to yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and stream banks. It has small, ovate leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Due to habitat loss and invasive species, Tripogandra ionantha is considered endangered and is a subject of conservation efforts.
